I accomplished my goal of leaving Wordpress today! It was a hard challenge but my blog is now powered by Jekyll and hosted on Github.

Under construction! This site is coded by hand with no frameworks. I'm ready to start learning new skills so I can make this blog awesome.

Why Jekyll?

  • No heavy CMS, database or FTP to deal with.
  • Hosting is free using Github pages!
  • I now get version control and deployment in one place.
  • Direct control over my markup. No more rich-text editor for writing posts.
  • Super fast! I went from 5 s to 300 ms improving load times by 94%.

8th Light Apprenticeship: Skill Assessment

Strengths

  • Minimalistic clean design
  • Use of typography
  • Usability first
  • Good understanding of mobile first design (RWD)
  • Creative problem solver and team player

Design: Average

  • Use color more and study theory
  • Take illustration classes
  • Plan and sketch more before designing
  • Improve logo designs

HTML 5/CSS 3: Beginner

  • Learn semantic HTML and best practices
  • SASS
  • CSS animations
  • Make this site responsive with no frameworks

Git/Github: Beginner

  • Practice makes perfect
  • Learn pull and merge
  • Finish Code School challenges

jQuery: Noob

  • Learn basics
  • Best practices
  • Start Code School challenges
